intro: Polygala varians, commonly known as the variable milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, often pink or white,蝶形花 (butterfly-shaped) flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately compound, and often have a hairy texture. Polygala varians is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its historical use in traditional medicine.
